Description: Ashwagandha is an ancient medicinal herb with multiple health benefits.
Uses: Helps reduce stress and anxiety, boosts brain function, and increases energy levels.
Precautions: Avoid during pregnancy. Consult a physician if you have diabetes or thyroid problems.
Overview: Ashwagandha is known for its adaptogenic properties, helping the body manage stress.
SideEffects: May cause drowsiness, upset stomach, or nausea in some individuals.
Doses: 1-2 capsules or 500mg-1000mg per day, as directed by a healthcare provider.

Description: Brahmi is a powerful herb known to improve memory and cognitive functions.
Uses: Supports memory retention, enhances mental clarity, and reduces anxiety.
Precautions: Avoid during pregnancy and breastfeeding. Consult a doctor if on medication for thyroid or heart diseases.
Overview: Brahmi has been used traditionally to improve brain function and enhance memory.
SideEffects: Some users report nausea, dry mouth, or digestive discomfort.
Doses: 300-500mg per day or as recommended by an Ayurvedic practitioner.

Description: Triphala is a combination of three fruits, used for detoxification and improving digestion.
Uses: Promotes digestive health, detoxifies the body, and supports weight management.
Precautions: Not recommended for pregnant women. High doses may cause diarrhea.
Overview: Triphala has powerful cleansing and rejuvenating properties for the body.
SideEffects: In some cases, may cause stomach cramps, diarrhea, or dehydration.
Doses: 1 teaspoon of Triphala powder in warm water or 1-2 capsules per day.

Description: Shatavari is a female reproductive tonic and is used to balance hormones.
Uses: Supports women's health, improves fertility, and regulates menstrual cycles.
Precautions: Consult a physician if you have a hormone-sensitive condition. Not recommended during pregnancy without consultation.
Overview: Shatavari is known as a rejuvenating herb for women and helps balance the hormonal system.
SideEffects: In rare cases, may cause allergic reactions, stomach upset, or diarrhea.
Doses: 500mg-1000mg per day or as directed by an Ayurvedic expert.

Description: Neem is renowned for its anti-inflammatory and antibacterial properties.
Uses: Helps treat skin conditions, purifies the blood, and boosts immunity.
Precautions: Avoid excessive use. Not recommended for children or pregnant women.
Overview: Neem has been used in Ayurvedic medicine for centuries to treat various skin and immune-related conditions.
SideEffects: May cause low blood sugar, fatigue, or liver issues if used in excess.
Doses: 1-2 neem tablets or 1 teaspoon of neem powder per day.

Description: Tulsi, or Holy Basil, is considered a sacred herb with medicinal properties.
Uses: Boosts immunity, helps relieve stress, and fights respiratory infections.
Precautions: Avoid excessive use. Not recommended during pregnancy.
Overview: Tulsi is an adaptogen and has antibacterial, antiviral, and anti-inflammatory properties.
SideEffects: In rare cases, may cause nausea, headache, or digestive upset.
Doses: 1-2 capsules or 1 teaspoon of Tulsi tea per day.

Description: Guggul is used for its anti-inflammatory and cholesterol-lowering properties.
Uses: Helps in managing cholesterol, supports joint health, and promotes weight loss.
Precautions: Consult a physician if you have liver or kidney issues.
Overview: Guggul is a resin extracted from trees, used in traditional medicine to treat obesity and high cholesterol.
SideEffects: May cause diarrhea, headache, or skin rash in some individuals.
Doses: 500mg-1000mg per day, typically taken with meals.

Description: Haritaki is a fruit used in Ayurveda for digestive and respiratory health.
Uses: Improves digestion, promotes bowel health, and supports lung function.
Precautions: May cause dehydration in some individuals. Avoid excessive use.
Overview: Haritaki is known for its detoxifying properties and ability to regulate digestive processes.
SideEffects: Can cause loose stools, dehydration, or upset stomach if taken in high doses.
Doses: 500mg-1000mg per day, usually taken with warm water.

Description: Arjuna is a heart tonic used in Ayurveda to support cardiovascular health.
Uses: Improves heart function, regulates blood pressure, and supports cholesterol levels.
Precautions: Consult a physician if you have any existing heart conditions. Avoid excessive use.
Overview: Arjuna is known for its powerful cardiovascular benefits and is often used in herbal heart tonics.
SideEffects: May cause dizziness, headache, or nausea in some individuals.
Doses: 500mg-1000mg per day or as directed by an Ayurvedic practitioner.

Description: Guduchi is an immunity-boosting herb used for detoxification and vitality.
Uses: Boosts immune function, supports detoxification, and promotes longevity.
Precautions: Avoid excessive use. Consult a physician if on medication for autoimmune conditions.
Overview: Guduchi is known for its rejuvenating properties and is often used in traditional remedies for immunity and vitality.
SideEffects: Some users may experience mild digestive upset or allergic reactions.
Doses: 500mg-1000mg per day or as prescribed by a healthcare provider.

Description: Manjistha is a powerful blood purifier used in Ayurvedic medicine.
Uses: Helps cleanse the blood, improve skin health, and support liver function.
Precautions: Avoid during pregnancy. Consult a doctor before use if you have a liver condition.
Overview: Manjistha is often used in herbal treatments to support the detoxification of the blood and promote clear skin.
SideEffects: May cause nausea, diarrhea, or digestive discomfort in some individuals.
Doses: 500mg-1000mg per day, typically taken with warm water.

Description: Amla is a powerful antioxidant-rich fruit known for its high vitamin C content.
Uses: Boosts immunity, supports digestion, and promotes healthy skin and hair.
Precautions: Avoid excessive use. May not be suitable for people with low blood sugar.
Overview: Amla is widely used in Ayurvedic medicine to improve overall health and vitality.
SideEffects: In rare cases, may cause digestive upset or diarrhea.
Doses: 1-2 capsules or 1 teaspoon of Amla powder per day.

Description: Licorice root is known for its anti-inflammatory and soothing properties.
Uses: Helps soothe digestive issues, supports respiratory health, and reduces inflammation.
Precautions: Not recommended for people with high blood pressure or heart conditions.
Overview: Licorice is often used in traditional medicine to treat digestive and respiratory issues.
SideEffects: In excessive doses, may cause high blood pressure, headaches, or fatigue.
Doses: 300-500mg per day or as recommended by a healthcare professional.
